abstract: Returns a proxy object for the receiver that can be used to initiate implied animation for property changes.
overview:
## Return Value

Returns a proxy object for the receiver that can initiate implied animations in response to property changes.

## Discussion

The animator proxy object  should be treated as if it was the receiver itself, and may be passed to any code that accepts the receiver as a parameter.

Sending key-value coding compliant “set” messages to the proxy will trigger animation for automatically animated properties of its target object, if the active [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAnimationContext] in the current thread has a duration value greater than zero, and an animation for the property key is found by the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAnimatablePropertyContainer] search mechanism.

# animator()

**Instance Method**

Returns a proxy object for the receiver that can be used to initiate implied animation for property changes.

## Declaration

```swift
func animator() -> Self
```

## Return Value

Returns a proxy object for the receiver that can initiate implied animations in response to property changes.

## Discussion

The animator proxy object  should be treated as if it was the receiver itself, and may be passed to any code that accepts the receiver as a parameter.

Sending key-value coding compliant “set” messages to the proxy will trigger animation for automatically animated properties of its target object, if the active [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAnimationContext] in the current thread has a duration value greater than zero, and an animation for the property key is found by the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAnimatablePropertyContainer] search mechanism.
title: animator()
